channel.title: NHC Eastern North Pacific
channel.description: Active tropical cyclones in the Eastern North Pacific

item.title: Eastern North Pacific Tropical Weather Outlook
item.description:
216
ABPZ20 KNHC 122336
TWOEP

Tropical Weather Outlook
NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL
500 PM PDT Wed Jul 12 2023

For the eastern North Pacific...east of 140 degrees west longitude:

Active Systems:
The National Hurricane Center is issuing advisories on Tropical
Storm Calvin, located about 700 miles south-southwest of the
southern tip of the Baja California peninsula.

Tropical cyclone formation is not expected during the next 7 days.

$$
Forecaster Bucci
item.author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)

item.title: Summary for Tropical Storm Calvin (EP3/EP032023)
item.author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
item.description: ...CALVIN SLIGHTLY STRONGER... As of 5:00 PM HST Wed Jul 12 the center of Calvin was located near 12.6, -114.9 with movement W at 17 mph. The minimum central pressure was 995 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 70 mph.

item.title: Tropical Storm Calvin Public Advisory Number 6
item.description:
Issued at 500 PM HST Wed Jul 12 2023 

840 
WTPZ33 KNHC 130239
TCPEP3
 
BULLETIN
Tropical Storm Calvin Advisory Number   6
NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL       EP032023
500 PM HST Wed Jul 12 2023
 
...CALVIN SLIGHTLY STRONGER...
 
 
SUMMARY OF 500 PM HST...0300 UTC...INFORMATION
----------------------------------------------
LOCATION...12.6N 114.9W
ABOUT 785 MI...1260 KM SSW OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA
MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...70 MPH...110 KM/H
PRESENT MOVEMENT...W OR 270 DEGREES AT 17 MPH...28 KM/H
MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...995 MB...29.39 INCHES
 
 
WATCHES AND WARNINGS
--------------------
There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.
 
 
DISCUSSION AND OUTLOOK
----------------------
At 500 PM HST (0300 UTC), the center of Tropical Storm Calvin was
located near latitude 12.6 North, longitude 114.9 West. Calvin is
moving toward the west near 17 mph (28 km/h), and this motion is
expected to continue the next several days.
 
Maximum sustained winds have increased to near 70 mph (110 km/h) 
with higher gusts.  Additional strengthening is forecast during the 
next couple of days, and Calvin is forecast to become a hurricane 
later tonight.
 
Tropical-storm-force winds extend outward up to 60 miles (95 km)
from the center.
 
The estimated minimum central pressure is 995 mb (29.39 inches).
 
 
HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND
----------------------
None
 
 
NEXT ADVISORY
-------------
Next complete advisory at 1100 PM HST.
 
$$
Forecaster Bucci
item.author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)

item.title: Tropical Storm Calvin Forecast Advisory Number 6
item.description:
Issued at 0300 UTC THU JUL 13 2023 

000
WTPZ23 KNHC 130238
TCMEP3
 
TROPICAL STORM CALVIN FORECAST/ADVISORY NUMBER   6
NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL       EP032023
0300 UTC THU JUL 13 2023
 
NOTICE... LAND-BASED TROPICAL CYCLONE WATCHES AND WARNINGS ARE NO
LONGER INCLUDED IN THE TROPICAL CYCLONE FORECAST/ADVISORY...(TCM).
CURRENT LAND-BASED COASTAL WATCHES AND WARNINGS CAN BE FOUND IN THE
MOST RECENTLY ISSUED TROPICAL CYCLONE PUBLIC ADVISORY...(TCP).
 
TROPICAL STORM CENTER LOCATED NEAR 12.6N 114.9W AT 13/0300Z
POSITION ACCURATE WITHIN  20 NM
 
PRESENT MOVEMENT TOWARD THE WEST OR 270 DEGREES AT  15 KT
 
ESTIMATED MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE  995 MB
MAX SUSTAINED WINDS  60 KT WITH GUSTS TO  75 KT.
50 KT....... 30NE  10SE   0SW  30NW.
34 KT....... 50NE  40SE  30SW  40NW.
12 FT SEAS..120NE  30SE   0SW  45NW.
WINDS AND SEAS VARY GREATLY IN EACH QUADRANT.  RADII IN NAUTICAL
MILES ARE THE LARGEST RADII EXPECTED ANYWHERE IN THAT QUADRANT.
 
REPEAT...CENTER LOCATED NEAR 12.6N 114.9W AT 13/0300Z
AT 13/0000Z CENTER WAS LOCATED NEAR 12.5N 114.2W
 
FORECAST VALID 13/1200Z 12.7N 117.0W
MAX WIND  70 KT...GUSTS  85 KT.
64 KT... 10NE   0SE   0SW   5NW.
50 KT... 40NE  10SE  10SW  30NW.
34 KT... 60NE  50SE  40SW  60NW.
 
FORECAST VALID 14/0000Z 13.0N 119.7W
MAX WIND  80 KT...GUSTS 100 KT.
64 KT... 15NE   0SE   0SW  10NW.
50 KT... 50NE  20SE  20SW  40NW.
34 KT... 80NE  60SE  50SW  80NW.
 
FORECAST VALID 14/1200Z 13.7N 122.5W
MAX WIND  85 KT...GUSTS 105 KT.
64 KT... 15NE   5SE   5SW  10NW.
50 KT... 60NE  20SE  20SW  50NW.
34 KT...110NE  60SE  60SW  90NW.
 
FORECAST VALID 15/0000Z 14.4N 125.4W
MAX WIND  85 KT...GUSTS 105 KT.
64 KT... 20NE   5SE   5SW  20NW.
50 KT... 60NE  30SE  30SW  50NW.
34 KT...110NE  70SE  70SW  90NW.
 
FORECAST VALID 15/1200Z 15.0N 128.4W
MAX WIND  80 KT...GUSTS 100 KT.
50 KT... 60NE  30SE  30SW  40NW.
34 KT...120NE  70SE  70SW  90NW.
 
FORECAST VALID 16/0000Z 15.6N 131.4W
MAX WIND  75 KT...GUSTS  90 KT.
50 KT... 50NE  30SE  20SW  40NW.
34 KT... 90NE  60SE  60SW  90NW.
 
EXTENDED OUTLOOK. NOTE...ERRORS FOR TRACK HAVE AVERAGED NEAR 100 NM
ON DAY 4 AND 125 NM ON DAY 5...AND FOR INTENSITY NEAR 15 KT EACH DAY
 
OUTLOOK VALID 17/0000Z 16.7N 138.0W
MAX WIND  60 KT...GUSTS  75 KT.
 
OUTLOOK VALID 18/0000Z 17.7N 144.7W
MAX WIND  50 KT...GUSTS  60 KT.
 
REQUEST FOR 3 HOURLY SHIP REPORTS WITHIN 300 MILES OF 12.6N 114.9W
 
NEXT ADVISORY AT 13/0900Z
 
$$
FORECASTER BUCCI
item.author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)

item.title: Tropical Storm Calvin Forecast Discussion Number 6
item.description:
Issued at 500 PM HST Wed Jul 12 2023 

000
WTPZ43 KNHC 130240
TCDEP3
 
Tropical Storm Calvin Discussion Number   6
NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL       EP032023
500 PM HST Wed Jul 12 2023
 
Calvin continues to steadily strengthen.  A couple microwave passes 
from within the past few hours showed that storm had a nearly closed 
low-level eye and a mid-level eye open to the northwest.  Recent 
geostationary satellite imagery suggests the storm's inner core may 
have experienced some dry air entrainment from that quadrant.  
However, deep convection with over-shooting tops is still present in 
the eastern portion of the circulation.  Subjective satellite Dvorak 
estimates from SAB and TAFB were T4.0/65 kt and T3.5/55 kt, 
respectively.  The initial intensity has been increased to 60 kt 
based on a blend of these estimates.

Atmospheric and oceanic conditions are conducive for additional 
strengthening.  Calvin is forecast to be in a generally moist 
environment, with low vertical wind shear, and warm sea surface 
temperatures for the next few days.  After 72 h, the SSTs beneath 
the storm are expected to gradually cool, while vertical wind shear 
increases and mid-level humidity decreases.  The combination of 
these factors should induce a weakening trend during this portion of 
the forecast period.  The official intensity prediction is similar 
to the previous advisory and is stronger than most of the guidance 
due to the potential for rapid intensification in the short-term 
forecast.

The storm is moving westward at about 15 kt.  A ridge to the north 
is steering Calvin at a brisk pace and a west to west-northwest 
motion should continue through the end of the forecast period.  
There is still notable spread in the model guidance related to the 
along-track speed of the cyclone.  The NHC track forecast is similar 
to the previous advisory and favors the faster model guidance, 
falling between the simple and corrected consensus aids. 
 
 
FORECAST POSITIONS AND MAX WINDS
 
INIT  13/0300Z 12.6N 114.9W   60 KT  70 MPH
 12H  13/1200Z 12.7N 117.0W   70 KT  80 MPH
 24H  14/0000Z 13.0N 119.7W   80 KT  90 MPH
 36H  14/1200Z 13.7N 122.5W   85 KT 100 MPH
 48H  15/0000Z 14.4N 125.4W   85 KT 100 MPH
 60H  15/1200Z 15.0N 128.4W   80 KT  90 MPH
 72H  16/0000Z 15.6N 131.4W   75 KT  85 MPH
 96H  17/0000Z 16.7N 138.0W   60 KT  70 MPH
120H  18/0000Z 17.7N 144.7W   50 KT  60 MPH
 
$$
Forecaster Bucci
item.author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)

item.title: Tropical Storm Calvin Wind Speed Probabilities Number 6
item.description:
Issued at 0300 UTC THU JUL 13 2023 

000
FOPZ13 KNHC 130239
PWSEP3
                                                                    
TROPICAL STORM CALVIN WIND SPEED PROBABILITIES NUMBER   6           
NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL       EP032023               
0300 UTC THU JUL 13 2023                                            
                                                                    
AT 0300Z THE CENTER OF TROPICAL STORM CALVIN WAS LOCATED NEAR       
LATITUDE 12.6 NORTH...LONGITUDE 114.9 WEST WITH MAXIMUM SUSTAINED   
WINDS NEAR 60 KTS...70 MPH...110 KM/H.                              
                                                                    
Z INDICATES COORDINATED UNIVERSAL TIME (GREENWICH)                  
   PACIFIC  DAYLIGHT TIME (PDT)...SUBTRACT 7 HOURS FROM Z TIME      
   HAWAIIAN STANDARD TIME (HST)...SUBTRACT 10 HOURS FROM Z TIME     
                                                                    
WIND SPEED PROBABILITY TABLE FOR SPECIFIC LOCATIONS                 
                                                                    
CHANCES OF SUSTAINED (1-MINUTE AVERAGE) WIND SPEEDS OF AT LEAST     
   ...34 KT (39 MPH... 63 KM/H)...                                  
   ...50 KT (58 MPH... 93 KM/H)...                                  
   ...64 KT (74 MPH...119 KM/H)...                                  
FOR LOCATIONS AND TIME PERIODS DURING THE NEXT 5 DAYS               
                                                                    
PROBABILITIES FOR LOCATIONS ARE GIVEN AS OP(CP) WHERE               
    OP  IS THE PROBABILITY OF THE EVENT BEGINNING DURING            
        AN INDIVIDUAL TIME PERIOD (ONSET PROBABILITY)               
   (CP) IS THE PROBABILITY OF THE EVENT OCCURRING BETWEEN           
        00Z THU AND THE FORECAST HOUR (CUMULATIVE PROBABILITY)      
                                                                    
PROBABILITIES ARE GIVEN IN PERCENT                                  
X INDICATES PROBABILITIES LESS THAN 1 PERCENT                       
PROBABILITIES FOR 34 KT AND 50 KT ARE SHOWN AT A GIVEN LOCATION WHEN
THE 5-DAY CUMULATIVE PROBABILITY IS AT LEAST 3 PERCENT.             
PROBABILITIES FOR 34...50...64 KT SHOWN WHEN THE 5-DAY              
64-KT CUMULATIVE PROBABILITY IS AT LEAST 1 PERCENT.
